title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: install package, start R enter (un-commented): now load packages needed current vignette:
code: # if (!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) #     install.packages("devtools") #  # devtools::install_github(repo = 'https://github.com/UCLouvain-CBIO/MDSvis') suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(HDCytoData)) library(CytoMDS) library(MDSvis)

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: MDSvis package implements visualization Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects representing low dimensional projection sample distances. objects can obtained using functionalities implemented CytoMDS package (Hauchamps et al. (2025)). information see CytoMDS vignette. visualization done via Shiny app allows user interactively customise plots depending series input parameters (see CytoMDS::ggplotSampleMDS() function details parameters). IMPORTANT: example provided current vignette uses cytometry data. result, distance matrix, contains pairwise sample distances, serves input MDS projection, calculated cytometry data samples using CytoMDS package. However, input MDS object can also calculated distance matrix, units interest necessarily cytometry samples.

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: load illustrative mass cytometry (CyTOF) dataset (Krieg et al. 2018), accessible Bioconductor HDCytoData data package (Weber Soneson (2019)). Krieg_Anti_PD_1 used characterize immune cell subsets peripheral blood melanoma skin cancer patients treated anti-PD-1 immunotherapy. study found frequency CD14+CD16-HLA-DRhi monocytes baseline samples (taken patients prior treatment) strong predictor survival response immunotherapy treatment. Notably, dataset contains strong batch effect, due sample acquisition two different days (Krieg et al. (2018)).
code: Krieg_fs <- Krieg_Anti_PD_1_flowSet() ## see ?HDCytoData and browseVignettes('HDCytoData') for documentation ## loading from cache ## Warning in updateObjectFromSlots(object, ..., verbose = verbose): dropping ## slot(s) 'colnames' from object = 'flowSet' Krieg_fs ## A flowSet with 20 experiments. ##  ## column names(49): Pd104Di Pd105Di ... batch_id sample_id

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: Next build phenodata dataframe experimental design information, found cytometry data structures. Next, scale-transform mass cytometry data calculate pairwise distance matrix. distance matrix, can now calculate MDS projection. also done using CytoMDS package. Optionally, use biplots interpretation tool, sample specific statistics can provided user. calculate standard univariate statistics variable multidimensional distribution (using CytoMDS package). save newly created objects .rds files. files can now selected within shiny app visualization.
code: # update phenoData structure  chLabels <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO$channel_name chMarkers <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO$marker_name marker_class <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO$marker_class  chLabels <- chLabels[marker_class != "none"] chMarkers <- chMarkers[marker_class != "none"] # marker_class all equal to "type", 24 markers are left  phenoData <- flowCore::pData(Krieg_fs) additionalPhenoData <-      keyword(Krieg_fs[[1]], "EXPERIMENT_INFO")$EXPERIMENT_INFO phenoData <- cbind(phenoData, additionalPhenoData)      flowCore::pData(Krieg_fs) <- phenoData # transform flow set (arcsinh(cofactor = 5)) trans <- arcsinhTransform(     transformationId="ArcsinhTransform",      a = 0,      b = 1/5,      c = 0)  # Applying arcsinh() transformation Krieg_fs_trans <- transform(     Krieg_fs,     transformList(chLabels, trans))  # Calculating Sample distances pwDist <- pairwiseEMDDist(     Krieg_fs_trans,     channels = chMarkers,     verbose = FALSE ) mdsObj <- computeMetricMDS(     pwDist,     seed = 0)  show(mdsObj) ## MDS object containing MDS projection (using Smacof algorithm)  data: ## Nb of dimensions:  2  ## Nb of points:  20  ## Stress:  0.052363  ## Pseudo RSquare:  0.984008  ## Goodness of fit:  0.997258 # Computing sample statistics  # statFUNs = c("median" = stats::median, #              "Q25" = function(x, na.rm) { #                  stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.25) #              }, #              "Q75" = function(x, na.rm) { #                  stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.75) #              }, #              "standard deviation" = stats::sd) # chStats <- channelSummaryStats(BCRXL_fs_trans, #                                channels = chLabels,  #                                statFUNs = statFUNs)  statFUNs <- c("median" = stats::median,               "std-dev" = stats::sd,               "mean" = base::mean,               "Q25" = function(x, na.rm)                    stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.25, na.rm = na.rm),               "Q75" = function(x, na.rm)                    stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.75, na.rm = na.rm))  chStats <- CytoMDS::channelSummaryStats(     Krieg_fs_trans,     channels = chMarkers,     statFUNs = statFUNs) saveRDS(mdsObj, file = "mdsObj.rds") saveRDS(phenoData, file = "phenoData.rds") saveRDS(chStats, file = "chStats.rds")

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: MDSvis function run_app launches interactive Shiny app three tabs window figure gets opened. ‘Input files’ tab objects can loaded visualization. plots shown ‘View’ tab ‘General settings’ contains technical plot settings controls. input files expected .rds extension least file containing MDS object loaded. Optionally phenodata file containing phenodata dataframe /file containing list statistics biplot visualization can loaded. can select previously created files proceed visualization. Note phenodata file selected new control appears allowing select subset variables (default selected). phenodata selected variables ones available drop-list controls ‘View’ tab. can now open ‘View’ tab see plot projection results. controls side allow choose projection axes; colour, label, define facet shape points according phenodata variables; add biplot; show plotly plot interactive plot exploration flip axes. example can colour points according group_id, label points according sample_id, use shapes according batch_id, shown figure . can also defne facets according two batches, figure :  can also add biplot created based sample statistics clicking biplot checkbox. idea calculate correlation sample statistics w.r.t. axes projection, correlations can represented correlation circle overlaid projection plot. desired statistic can selected drop menu possible show arrows respect selected length threshold. example , chosen statistic median arrow length threshold 0.8.  data large displayed labels, one possible solution display interactive plotly plot regular one selecting corresponding checkbox. can add new plotly tooltips highlight corresponding information point hovering .  Finally, obtained plots can exported pdf file. user can defined corresponding plot title, pdf file name plot size (height) used.

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: completeness show ‘General settings’ tab contains general controls regarding e.g. points features, corresponding labels biplot arrows. details see CytoMDS::ggplotSampleMDS() function parameters.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrea Vicini. Author. Philippe Hauchamps. Author, maintainer. Laurent Gatto. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vicini , Hauchamps P, Gatto L (2025). MDSvis: Plots MDS results. R package version 0.1.5, https://uclouvain-cbio.github.io/MDSvis.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MDSvis: Plots of MDS results},   author = {Andrea Vicini and Philippe Hauchamps and Laurent Gatto},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.5},   url = {https://uclouvain-cbio.github.io/MDSvis}, }

title: Plots of MDS results
text: MDSvis package implements visualization Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects representing low dimensional projection cytometry samples. objects can obtained using functionalities implemented CytoMDS package. visualization realised via Shiny app allows user interactively customise plots depending series input parameters. screenshot app ‘View’ tab. controls side allow choose projection axes, colour, label, facet shape points according phenodata variables, add biplot, show plotly plot interactive plot exploration flip axes.

title: Plots of MDS results
text: install package run following lines: Note CytoMDS version 1.3.5 needs installed .

title: Plots of MDS results

title: Plots of MDS results
text: use MDSvis research, please use following citation: Hauchamps, Philippe, Simon Delandre, Stéphane T. Temmerman, Dan Lin, Laurent Gatto. 2025. “Visual Quality Control CytoMDS, Bioconductor Package Low Dimensional Representation Cytometry Sample Distances.” Cytometry. Part : Journal International Society Analytical Cytology 107 (3): 177–86.
